story:
Once upon a time, in a lush, green jungle in Indonesia, there was a young boy named Beni. Beni lived in a small village near a river and spent his days playing with his friends, exploring the jungle, and helping his parents with their work.

One day, Beni heard a strange noise coming from deep in the jungle. He followed the sound and soon found himself in front of a large, magnificent tree. The noise was coming from inside the tree, and as Beni listened carefully, he realized it was the sound of a baby bird, crying for help.

Beni looked up and saw a small bird with bright, colorful feathers, stuck in a hole in the tree. Beni knew that the bird was in trouble, and he wanted to help. He searched for something to use to free the bird, and soon found a long, sturdy stick.

With all his might, Beni pushed the stick into the hole and carefully nudged the baby bird out. The bird was frightened but unharmed, and Beni held it gently in his hands.

The bird looked up at Beni with its bright, shining eyes, and Beni knew that he had made a new friend. From that day on, Beni and the bird, who he named Rini, became inseparable. They spent their days exploring the jungle together, with Rini perched on Beni's shoulder and chirping happily.

One day, Beni and Rini were out exploring when they stumbled upon a hidden cave. The cave was dark and scary, but something told Beni that he needed to go inside. He took a deep breath and stepped into the darkness.

As Beni's eyes adjusted to the darkness, he realized that the cave was filled with treasure. There were golden coins, sparkling jewels, and other valuable items. Beni didn't know what to do. He wanted to take the treasure and share it with his village, but he also knew that it wasn't right to take something that didn't belong to him.

Just then, Rini began to chirp and fly around in circles. Beni followed the bird and soon realized that Rini was leading him to a small, hidden opening at the back of the cave. Beni crawled through the opening and found himself in a beautiful, sunlit clearing.

The clearing was filled with flowers and plants, and Beni realized that it was the home of a group of magical creatures. The creatures were small and delicate, with shimmering wings and gentle expressions. They thanked Beni for returning their treasure and told him that they had been watching over him and Rini since the day they met.

Beni was amazed, but he also felt a sense of peace. He knew that he had done the right thing by returning the treasure, and he was grateful for the friendship of Rini and the magical creatures.

From that day on, Beni and Rini continued to explore the jungle and have many adventures together. They knew that they had a special bond, and that they would always be there for each other. And as Beni drifted off to sleep each night, he would dream of his adventures with Rini and the magical creatures, and he knew that he was truly blessed.

The end.

Good night, my son. May you have sweet dreams and always be brave and kind, like Beni.
